description: From Latin excerptus, past participle of excerpere (“to pick out”), from ex (“out”) + carpere (“to pick, pluck”).

entries.meaning: A clip, snippet, passage or extract from a larger work such as a news article, a film, or a literary composition.

verbs.description: excerpt (third-person singular simple present excerpts, present participle excerpting, simple past and past participle excerpted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To select or copy sample material (excerpts) from a work.
examples: out of which we have excerpted the following remarkable particulars
